autoop.core.ml.model.model module

class autoop.core.ml.model.model.ClassificationFacadeModel[source]

Bases: Model

Abstract subclass representing a general regression model.

This class provides base functionality for regression models it is not intended to be instantiated on its own.

type

Specifies the model type as ‘classification’.

Type:

Literal[“regression”, “classification”]

model

The wrapped model instance.

Type:

BaseEstimator

fit(observations: ndarray, labels: ndarray) → None[source]

Fit the model to observations and labels.

Uses the wrapped models fit method.

Parameters:

  • observations (np.ndarray) – Array of training data.

  • labels (np.ndarray) – Array of target labels.

Raises:

  • AssertionError – If the number of samples in observations

  • and labels do not match or there are less than 2 classes –

  • to classify. –

Returns:

None

property model: BaseEstimator

Get a deep copy of the underlying model instance.

Returns:

A copy of the wrapped model instance

used in training and prediction.

Return type:

BaseEstimator

predict(observations: ndarray) → Tensor[source]

Predict class labels for the given observations.

Uses the wrapped models predict method.

Parameters:

observations (np.ndarray) – Array of observations to predict.

Raises:

NotFittedError – If the model has not been fitted.

Returns:

Predicted class labels as a tensor.

class autoop.core.ml.model.model.RegressionModel[source]

Bases: Model

Abstract subclass representing a general regression model.

This class provides base functionality for regression models it is not intended to be instantiated on its own.

type

Specifies the model type as ‘regression’.

Type:

Literal[“regression”, “classification”]

fit(observations: ndarray, labels: ndarray) → None[source]

Fit the regression model to observations and labels.

Parameters:

  • observations (np.ndarray) – Training data used to fit the model.

  • labels (np.ndarray) – Target values corresponding to observations. Expected shape is either [B, 1] or [B].

Raises:

  • ValueError – If labels have an unsupported shape.

  • AssertionError – If the number of samples in observations and labels do not match.

Returns:

None

predict(observations: ndarray) → Tensor[source]

Generate predictions using the trained model.

Parameters:

observations (np.ndarray) – Data for which predictions are needed.

Raises:

NotFittedError – If the model has not been fitted.

Returns:

Predictions made by the model.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

class autoop.core.ml.model.trainer.Trainer(model: Module, loss_fn: Callable[[Tensor, Tensor], Tensor], num_epochs: int = 10, lr: float = 0.001, optimizer: Literal['adam', 'rmsprop', 'SGD'] = 'adam')[source]

train(observations: Tensor, labels: Tensor) → None[source]

Run the training loop for the model.

For each epoch, performs a forward pass, calculates loss, and backpropagates to update model parameters.

Parameters:

  • observations (Tensor) – Training data for the model.

  • labels (Tensor) – Targets corresponding to the observations.

Returns:

None

Module contents

This package provides machine learning models for classification and regression. Also provides a factory function to retrieve models.

Available Models:

  • Regression: MultipleLinearRegression, Lasso, ElasticNet

  • Classification: SupportVectorClassifier (SVC),

    MultiLayerPerceptron (MLP), RandomForestClassifier

Functions:

  • get_model: Returns an instance of the specified model by name.
